title: Fattoria San Felo 2016 Le Stoppie Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with enticing aromas of Bartlett pear, chamomile and Spanish broom. The structured savory palate offers white peach, nectarine and a touch of ginger alongside fresh acidity.

title: Fowles Wine 2016 Ladies who Shoot their Lunch Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Victoria)
description: Unapologetically rich, this full-bodied wine offers heady aromas of baking spices, butterscotch and toast. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, with plenty of spicy, oak notes but also a bounty of peach and melon fruit to keep things balanced.
designation: Ladies who Shoot their Lunch Wild Ferment

title: Günther Steinmetz 2014 Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Mosel)
description: Whiffs of brandy and black tea leaves accent delicate black cherry and violet in this lithe Pinot Noir. It's a frail beauty rather than a powerhouse, but invigorating in acidity. Delicate spice and soft but pleasantly astringent tannins mark a moderately long finish.

title: Hamacher 2015 H Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is intentionally made in a lighter style for near-term consumption, and it's showing salmonberry and raspberry fruit, with a sliver of toasted cracker. Tannins are nicely structured and it finishes with a touch of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2020.

title: Holloran 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This bottling takes a step up in concentration from the Stafford Hill cuvée, while retaining a comparable style. Pretty black raspberry and cherry fruit comes in a well-balanced elegant frame, with medium length and body.

title: Il Paradiso di Frassina 2013 12 Uve  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Earthy aromas of scorched earth, black-skinned berry and a whiff of black olive lead the nose. A blend of 40% Sangiovese and eleven other organically farmed grapes, the savory juicy palate offers Marasca cherry, licorice and vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: King Estate 2014 Backbone Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This is rather light, given that it is the winery's top-tier Pinot Noir. It's a pleasant, fruity blend of ripe watermelon, strawberry and light cherry fruit. Though quite well balanced, it feels slightly dilute, and should be consumed over the next couple of years.

title: Leeuwenkuil 2015 Grenache Blanc (Paardeberg)
description: Aromas of apple skin, beesway, musk melon and white flowers dance in the bouquet of this pretty white. There's a pithy, astringent texture to the palate that frames the ripe melon and white strawberry flavors, while an earthy spice unfolds on the finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Leverage 2015 Acceleration Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep black plum, vanilla, star anise and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this blend of 71% Grenache, 15% Mourvèdre and 14% Syrah. The palate is fairly rich and nearly sweet, with sugar plums and dark-brown-spice flavors, all balanced by a compelling texture and bright acidity.

title: Lourensford 2015 The Dome Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)
description: An enticing interplay between lightly grilled apple, spiced orange and honeydew form the bouquet of this ripe white. It's quite plush in feel, the weighty midpalate just lifted by the acidity. It finishes with dense flavors of orange creamsicle and wood-grilled peach. Drink now–2019.

title: Mamete Prevostini 2013 Albareda  (Sforzato di Valtellina)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of toasted oak, baked plum and leather. The concentrated palate delivers vanilla, espresso, black-cherry jam and licorice alongside assertive tannins.

title: Mullineux 2015 Kloof Street Red (Swartland)
description: This is a Syrah-led blend, with 23% Cinsault, 13% Carignan, 7% Tinta Barocca and 6% Grenache. It's well defined and loaded with attractive spicy tones of Frankincense, baking spice and cherry pie. The medium-weight palate offers surprising grip that frames the lush red-fruit flavors, with more of that sweet spice character prevailing on the close. Drink now–2020.

title: Orma 2016 Passi di Orma  (Bolgheri)
description: A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, green peppercorn and bay leaf. The firm palate delivers ripe black currant, vanilla and a touch of cedar alongside lithe tannins.

title: Ornellaia 2015 Le Serra Nuove  (Bolgheri)
description: Aromas of cassis, tobacco and ground pepper follow over to the austere palate along with anise and prune. Tightly woven fine-grained tannins offer taut support. Drink sooner rather than later to catch the fruit and freshness.

title: Parducci 2014 True Grit Reserve Red (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is packed with black cherry, dark chocolate and espresso flavors that coat the palate with a nicely thick texture. It's not overtly fruity, though, and has lots of fine tannins to shape the mouthfeel.

title: Phelps Creek 2015 Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Full bodied and flavorful, this still shows its tannic backbone a bit aggressively, but that should soften with another year or two in bottle. The core of fruit suggests berry preserves, complemented with a lick of chocolate.

title: Polvanera 2013 14 Vigneto Marchesana Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)
description: Sourced from the clay and limestone soils of the Marchesana Vineyard, this Primitivo is earthy in aromas of tilled earth, pressed violets and Mediterranean scrub. With no time in oak, the palate is transparent in its juicy bramble fruit intensity, with additional floral and herb notes imparting interest. A rich feel, balanced by bright acidity and integrated tannins make this immediately appealing.

title: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Muscat (Alsace)
description: A very subtle nose hints at roses and summer blossom. The dry palate puts its concentrated core against this aromatic richness and creates a subtle, understated balance. The finish is dry and refreshing.

title: Sidewood 2016 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: Lemon, stone fruit and guava aromas meet white pepper and wet stone minerality in this classic example of cool-climate Chardonnay. The palate offers crisp acidity balanced by an oily texture, making this rich enough for the dinner table but refreshing enough to sip on its own. Drink now–2021.

title: Thorne & Daughters 2015 Rocking Horse Cape of Good Hope White (Western Cape)
description: Made from 33% Roussanne, 23% Sémillon, 20% Chardonnay, 18% Chenin Blanc and 6% Clairette, this is broad and full right from the start, with notes of vanilla bean, creamed melon and orange preserves on the nose and mouth. There's just enough acidity to prevent it from feeling totally flat and flabby, while the finish is clean and medium in length. Drink now.
designation: Rocking Horse Cape of Good Hope

title: Triacca 2013 La Gatta Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This opens with aromas reminiscent of star anise, tobacco, woodland berry and a whiff of oak-driven spice. On the vibrant austere palate, bright acidity and lithe taut tannins provide tense support for cranberry, sour cherry and a hint of clove. Drink after 2020.

title: Villa Schinosa 2016 Laghiglione Red (Puglia)
description: Fresh, vibrant aromas of red berries and dark cherries are highlighted by graphite accents on the nose of this 60% Primitivo and 40% Syrah blend. The medium-bodied palate offers an engaging balance between juicy fruit and tense mineral and spice tones. Medium-grained tannins offer just enough grip and help extend the fruity finish.

title: Wolf Blass 2016 Reserve Release Chardonnay (South Australia)
description: This broad appellation Chardonnay is all about rinds—those from melons, peaches and lemons. The palate is tightly wound in bright acidity and balanced by a chalky texture. The finish brings notes of oak and bitter rinds.

title: Château Amour 2015  Médoc
description: This is a rich wine, generous with ripe berry fruit. Produced in the northern Médoc, it holds equal quantities of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, giving both juicy fruits and a firm structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Balac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This family-owned estate has produced a dark and dense wine. With plenty of ripe berry fruits and good acidity, it is well proportioned, juicy and firm. Perfumed black currants and a sense of balance are hallmarks of this wine. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Cangruey 2015  Médoc
description: This is a structured northern-Médoc wine with good aging potential from Jean-Jacques Baudoux. With its tannins well in play, it has a dry core that is emphasized by the spice and toast from wood aging. The wine is likely to need some time, so drink from 2022.

title: Château Clément Saint-Jean 2015  Médoc
description: With its classic blend of 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has both generous blackberry fruits and a core of firm tannins. The new-wood aging has added spice although it is judiciously used and doesn't overwhelm, leaving plenty of space for the fruit. Drink this structured wine from 2022.

title: Château Fontesteau 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This rich, spicy wine has a toasty element from the new-wood aging and also plenty of ripe, berry fruits and balanced acidity. It comes from a 74-acre vineyard that surround a 13th-century castle. This generous wine will age well. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Haut Barrail 2015  Médoc
description: Thirty-year-old vines and a predominance of Merlot gives Cyril Gillet's wine a good combination of concentration and fruitiness. It is a solid wine, juicy with black currants and with plenty of aging in front of it. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Haut-Logat 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: The 15 months of wood aging still shows in this young wine along with juicy, bright black-currant fruit. Let the two soften and this will be a serious, structured wine. Drink from 2024.
